Ted.Action: Engages politely with the Old Guy, shows interest in his stories.
Does not challenge or dismiss the Old Guy despite some teasing remarks.

Accepts the old man's cap when asked, showing willingness to participate despite being told he looks stupid.
Engages in friendly banter with Betty, acknowledges Sam's legacy respectfully.
Declines a drink offer politely, showing self-awareness.
Spews drink after Betty insists he take on the difficult night shift alone, showing vulnerability and openness.
Confidently acknowledges the big responsibility he is taking on, showing awareness of Sam's legacy and the challenge ahead.
Spews his drink and immediately says 'I can't' when faced with starting the night shift alone for the first time.
Insists he can't handle running the night shift alone due to inexperience and nervousness.

Eventually calms down and agrees to talk calmly with Betty.
Rejects Betty calling him 'Teddy', showing sensitivity.
Refuses to take the night shift, citing lack of experience and confidence running the place alone.

Struggles to calm down and maintain composure when challenged by Betty.
Negotiates a higher price for holding the fort, jokingly calling Betty a Nazi.
Agrees to cover the shift and take responsibility for the guests.
Negotiates a higher pay (fifty bucks) for taking over the night desk duty, showing awareness of his value and assertiveness.

Uses humor and playful insults (calling someone a Nazi) during negotiation, which could be seen as unprofessional or undermining the seriousness of the situation.
Agrees to the task without fully questioning the conditions or clarifying expectations, showing some passivity or limited initiative.

Maintains charm and good humor despite physical strain and awkward situations.

Checks the girl's reservation thoroughly and processes the check-in.

Continues to assist Athena by carrying luggage despite obvious difficulty.

Turns away quietly when the door shuts with force, showing no confrontation or resentment.

Carries all her bags inside awkwardly.
Hopes for a peek at Jezebel's charms, looks at tip received with a frown.
Makes eye contact with Raven despite himself.
Carries all her bags inside awkwardly, settles the bags down, looks at the tip with a frown, and makes eye contact with Raven despite his mood.
Provides clear directions to Raven confidently and tries to be helpful despite weariness.
Responds wearily and sarcastically to Raven's comments and the disruptive behavior of others, indicating frustration.
Offers to help Eva with her bags after she expresses worry about being late, demonstrating attentiveness and helpfulness.
Seems weary and somewhat disengaged in interactions, suggesting possible emotional exhaustion or lack of enthusiasm.

Offers to help Eva with her bags and carries them even though she insists she can manage.
Waits patiently while Eva looks for more tip money, showing awareness and prudence.
Wincing in disgust and excusing himself politely from a discussion he finds gross.

Responds to Athena's requests helpfully and listens despite apparent irritation around.
Wincing in disgust and excusing himself politely from an uncomfortable situation.

Smiles sincerely at Eva and experiences a genuine connection.
Shudders and huffs off when faced with the girls and the list, showing avoidance.
Scribbles down the list of items as instructed and attempts to proceed with the task despite feeling dizzy and disoriented.
Feels swooning dizziness and needs to be prompted to 'get to work', indicating lack of immediate confidence or control.
Looks upon the witches' feast, his eyes bulge, but he controls himself and shows sensitivity to Eva's sorrow rather than being distracted by others.
Steps back and avoids temptation, choosing to fetch the room-service cart instead of engaging in inappropriate behavior.

Covers Eva with a shawl as she looks worried and sighs.

Encourages Eva to explain her feelings and listens patiently.

Asks clarifying questions to understand the situation better, such as whether the rock was going to turn back into Diana.

Backs away and tries to resist Eva's advances despite the magical influence and pressure.

Speaks gently to children on the phone, offering milk and cookies and asking them to be good before bedtime.
Muttered 'Goddamn kids' to himself after the call.

Handles phone inquiries firmly and with a sense of authority, checks computer to verify information.

Responds politely and promptly to ice request, confirming details clearly.

Collapses to his knees and shows emotional overwhelm rather than confidence or control.
